title: July 15
description:
Happy Bastille Day! Lucie and Felix celebrated by going on an overnight trip to Great America, just the two of them.

Felix continues to rock the free world on his bike. No training wheels, no problem.

Milo's been in the adorable habit lately of telling us stories. They're mostly about the Incredible family and how trouble comes looking for them and how Jack Jack saves the day by changing into a robot, ball of fire, superstrong baby, or bad guy (=someone who fights, even if it is for a good cause).

children.title: Electronics
children.description: Felix has started taking stuff apart to find out how it works. We eagerly look forward to the day that he also starts putting stuff back together.

children.title: King Swim 1
children.description:
Felix can swim underwater! One small problem: he hasn't figured out how to come up for air. So he can swim for as long as he can hold his breath, but then he has to stand up.

Here's a video of him doing the backstroke.

children.title: King Swim 2
children.description: After swim class the kids relax at the playground in front of the pool, before the long walk back to school.

children.title: Milo
children.description:
Milo isn't old enough to go to swim class (though he DID try conning a new teacher into taking him last week). But he's enjoying his last few weeks of New School anyway. He's very proud to be in the 3 year old class with a new cubby and everything.

Bonus: moving up a class did a mental trick -- he is now fully potty trained!

children.title: Bedtime
children.description:
Bedtime for both boys, though especially Milo, has been getting gradually more difficult and drawn out. Milo's been bouncing out of bed like a basketball.

Lucie had the idea to implement a star system: one star every night they go to bed without fuss. When the stars are all filled, they get a surprise!

So far it's worked astonishingly well: the bedtime ritual's been shortened by a half hour. They hunker down and drift off, thinking hard about stars and surprises.

children.title: Room Service
children.description: Ever since Dean took Felix on a solo trip to the snow, Lucie and Felix have been wanting to do a special trip of their own. This weekend they took off to Santa Clara and stayed in a hotel with a pool and hot tub. Felix discovered the joys of room service.

children.title: Water Land
children.description: The trip destination: Santa Clara's Great America or, as Felix calls it, Water Land. Felix's favorite ride was Lazy River, where you get to float around on big intertubes.

children.title: Trip 3
children.description: Felix also liked the gondola flying high across the amusement park. Another big hit was a terrific magic show by Ed Alonzo.
